name: ApplyVolTransform
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
ApplyVolTransform, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.freesurfer.preprocess, interface: ApplyVolTransform).

Use FreeSurfer mri_vol2vol to apply a transform.

    Examples
    --------

    >>> from nipype.interfaces.freesurfer import ApplyVolTransform
    >>> applyreg = ApplyVolTransform()
    >>> applyreg.inputs.source_file = 'structural.nii'
    >>> applyreg.inputs.reg_file = 'register.dat'
    >>> applyreg.inputs.transformed_file = 'struct_warped.nii'
    >>> applyreg.inputs.fs_target = True
    >>> applyreg.cmdline
    'mri_vol2vol --fstarg --reg register.dat --mov structural.nii --o struct_warped.nii'

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str' and with values which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: Fs target
inputs.description: A boolean. Use orig.mgz from subject in regfile as target.

inputs.name: Fsl reg file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Fslras-to-fslras matrix (fsl format).

inputs.name: Interp
inputs.description: 'trilin' or 'nearest' or 'cubic'. Interpolation method (<trilin> or nearest).

inputs.name: Inverse
inputs.description: A boolean. Sample from target to source.

inputs.name: Invert morph
inputs.description: A boolean. Compute and use the inverse of the non-linear morph to resample the input volume. to be used by --m3z.

inputs.name: Lta file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Linear transform array file.

inputs.name: Lta inv file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Lta, invert.

inputs.name: M3z file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. This is the morph to be applied to the volume. unless the morph is in mri/transforms (eg.: for talairach.m3z computed by reconall), you will need to specify the full path to this morph and use the --nodefm3zpath flag.

inputs.name: Mni 152 reg
inputs.description: A boolean. Target mni152 space.

inputs.name: No ded m3z path
inputs.description: A boolean. To be used with the m3z flag. instructs the code not to look for them3z morph in the default location (subjects_dir/subj/mri/transforms), but instead just use the path indicated in --m3z.

inputs.name: No resample
inputs.description: A boolean. Do not resample; just change vox2ras matrix.

inputs.name: Reg file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Tkras-to-tkras matrix   (tkregister2 format).

inputs.name: Reg header
inputs.description: A boolean. Scannerras-to-scannerras matrix = identity.

inputs.name: Source file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Input volume you wish to transform.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.description: A string. Set matrix = identity and use subject for any templates.

inputs.name: Subjects dir
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing directory. Subjects directory.

inputs.name: Tal
inputs.description: A boolean. Map to a sub fov of mni305 (with --reg only).

inputs.name: Tal resolution
inputs.description: A float. Resolution to sample when using tal.

inputs.name: Target file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Output template volume.

inputs.name: Transformed file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. Output volume.

inputs.name: Xfm reg file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Scannerras-to-scannerras matrix (mni format).

output-files.name: Transformed file
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Path to output file if used normally.
